definition: to revere as sole orthodoxy/to hold supremacy (of a religion, ideology, cultural norm, social group etc)/to be dominant
alone/independent/single/sole/only
senior/of a senior generation/to honor/to respect/honorific/classifier for cannons and statues/ancient wine vessel
dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucians (slogan of the Former Han dynasty)
Dismiss the hundred schools, revere only the Confucian (idiom)/sole dominant ideology
pinyin: ba4 chu4 bai3 jia1 , du2 zun1 ru2 shu4

sentences.english: But from the start he plainly had an elevated sense of his own importance.
sentences.chinese: 但从一开始，他显然就有一种唯我独尊的心理。

sentences.english: TangTai-zong admired Wang's calligraphy very much which consolidated the Wang's respectable position in the calligraphy field.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗推崇王羲之书法，从而奠定了王书的独尊地位。

sentences.english: So, it was hard to regard the political opening of Emperor Hanwu as a product of "the Confucianism Worship Alone".
sentences.chinese: 充其量可以说，“独尊儒术”开武帝政治开放之一途。

sentences.english: Leaders in Russia and Brazil also expressed concerns about the dollar's primacy.
sentences.chinese: 俄罗斯和巴西的领导人也对美元独尊表达了担忧。

sentences.english: People are illogical, unreasonable and self-centered.
sentences.chinese: 人们往往会逻辑混乱，不可理喻，惟我独尊。

sentences.english: I believe in the power of love and sharing, and despise hatred and monopoly.
sentences.chinese: 我相信爱和分享的力量，藐视仇恨与唯我独尊。

definition: to unify/unified
to be above/to place above
Confucian orthodoxy
sage
sole ruler/dictator
tyrannical/brutal (regime)
the imperial court/the government in imperial times
Nirvana (in Buddhist scripture)/Lord Brahma (the Hindu Creator)
lit. true religion/orthodox religion/orthodox Christianity/Islam (in the writing of Chinese or Hui theologians)
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
Zhengtong Emperor, reign name of sixth Ming Emperor Zhu Qizhen 朱祁鎮|朱祁镇[Zhu1 Qi2 zhen4] (1427-1464), reigned 1435-1449, Temple name Yingzong 英宗[Ying1 zong1]
orthodox
to inspire awe throughout the empire (idiom)
outstanding heroes/warlords vying for supremacy (in former times)/stars (of sports or pop music)
Confucianism
Three Sovereigns, between Gods and Emperors in third millennium BC/usually listed as Suiren 燧人[Sui4 ren2], Fuxi 伏羲[Fu2 Xi1], trapping and writing, Shennong or Farmer God 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2]
supreme/paramount/unsurpassed
